intro: Boopis spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved boopis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are broad and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Boopis spathulata is known for its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
